articles.title: Centre reviews preparedness for cyclone over Bay of Bengal

articles.title: European Landscapes Transformed by Prehistoric Humans Before the Advent of Agriculture
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Neanderthals and Mesolithic hunter-gatherers managed and modified European forests through the use of fire. Archaeological and paleoecological data reveal widespread instances of forest clearing and burning, sometimes occurring tens of thousands of years ago. The impact of these early human activities was considerable. It suggests that humans were not merely passive inhabitants of the landscape, but active agents of environmental change.

articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: The three-day international conference on climate resilience and environmental fragility began at Hemvati Nandan Bahuguna Garhwal University's Chauras campus on Saturday. Geographers and scholars from across India and abroad are deliberating on the impact of climate change and strategies for sustainable development.

articles.title: Researchers are mapping heat to protect Californian farmworkers
articles.author: Dorany Pineda
articles.summary: Temperatures in Southern California have increased almost 3 F since the start of the 20th century. Seven of the last eight years through 2024 were the warmest on record. Southern California is heating up twice as fast as Northern California. Researchers from San Diego State University are mapping areas of extreme heat in the Imperial and Coachella valleys. They collected data from 300 farmworkers.
